form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE and NOTICE OF HEARING, Form I-221

full_text: lane - UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE 7880 Biscayne Blvd. Miami, FL 33138 ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE and NOTICE OF HEARING In Deportation Proceedings under Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act UNITED STATES OF AMERICA: File No: A28 688 810 In the Matter of: Teresa OROZCO, Respondent 335 NE 25th St. Miami, FL 33137 UPON inquiry conducted by the Immigration and Naturalization Service, it is alleged that: 1. You are not a citizen or national of the United States; 2. You are a native of Nicaragua, and citizen of Nicaragua; 3. You entered the United States at or near Miami, FL, on or about May 30, 1984; 4. You were then admitted as a nonimmigrant visitor for pleasure and authorized to remain in the United States until November 30, 1984; 5. You have remained in the United States beyond November 30, 1984 without authority of the United States Immigration & Naturalization Service. AND on the basis of the foregoing allegations, it is charged that you are subject to deportation pursuant to the following provision(s) of law: Section 241 (a) (2) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, in that, after admission as a nonimmigrant under Section 101 (a) (15) of said Act you have remained in the United States for a longer time than permitted. WHEREFORE, YOU ARE ORDERED to appear for hearing before an Immigration Judge of the Immigration and Naturalization Service of the United States Department of Justice at: a date, time and place to be set and show cause why you should not be deported from the United States on the charge (s) set forth above. Dated: MAR 1 8 1989 Assistant District Director for Examinations Form I-221 Miami, Florida IALIEN PROVIDED WITH VOLAG LEGAL SERVICES LIST
